definition: trick/deceit
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
method/technique
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea

sentences.english: That deceit won't pass with me.
It should make it easier to refuse to continue to accept such untruths.
sentences.chinese: 這必須變得更簡單來拒絕繼續接受這些虛假騙術。

sentences.english: One of the most common tricks pickpockets use is to wear a uniform to gain trust.
sentences.chinese: 騙子們常用的一個騙術之一是身穿制服博取信任。

sentences.english: He’d learned to chisel from these two.
sentences.chinese: 他是從這兩人身上學到的騙術。

sentences.english: Some scientists relegate parapsychology to the sphere of quackery .
sentences.chinese: 一些科學家把靈學歸類到騙術範圍。

sentences.english: These website legerdemain are not brillant.
sentences.chinese: 這些網站騙術並不高明。

sentences.english: So-called "evidence-based medicine" has become modern-day quackery.
sentences.chinese: 所謂的循證醫學已經成爲當今的庸醫騙術。

sentences.english: Medea flees the scene, smug in the success of her deception.
sentences.chinese: 而美狄亞爲着自己成功的騙術而自鳴得意着逃離了。

sentences.english: It's a deception, as far as I can discover.
sentences.chinese: 一個人的騙術縱使能瞞天過海，卻瞞不了自己的良心。

sentences.english: These guys try to take advantage of a little fake for the refs.
sentences.chinese: 這些傢伙試圖利用一點小騙術來欺騙裁判。

sentences.english: Some scientists relegate parapsychology to the sphere of quackery.
sentences.chinese: 一些科學家把靈學歸類到騙術範圍。

definition: lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
obscene language
specious arguments/sophistry
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
lit. small abacus/fig. selfish calculations/bean-counting
to exaggerate
to shift one's eyes/(fig.) to shift one's attention/to divert attention
riffraff/scum/lowlife/despicable/inferior
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
proponent/supporter/upholder
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
crafty plots and machinations (idiom)
sudden thrust (that catches the opponent off guard)
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
